title: ‘No one in Brussels could stop us!’ Article 50 author Lord Kerr says it IS reversible
text:
‘No one in Brussels could stop us!’ Article 50 author Lord Kerr says it IS reversible ‘No one in Brussels could stop us!’ Article 50 author Lord Kerr says it IS reversible THE author of Article 50 has insisted Brussels would have no power to stop Britain changing its mind on leaving the EU further down the line. PUBLISHED: 21:01, Tue, Feb 21, 2017 | UPDATED: 21:09, Tue, Feb 21, 2017 Lord Kerr of Kinlochard has batted away suggestions the Brexit Bill cannot be revoked and said it would be up to Britain. The former Secretary General of the European Convention urged the House of Lords to understand the bill was “not an expulsion procedure” and was “not irrevocable”. He said: “Parliament could invite the Government or the country to think again. An Article 50 notification is not irrevocable. “Article 50, which first saw the light of day under the heading voluntary withdrawal, is not an expulsion procedure. PARLIAMENT TV•GETTY Lord Kerr said Article 50 was "not an expulsion procedure" We certainly could and no one in Brussels could stop us Lord Kerr “We remain full members of the European Union throughout the negotiation period, the two years or its extension and if, having looked into the abyss, we were to change our minds about withdrawal, we certainly could and no one in Brussels could stop us.” The cross bench peer added the President of the European Council along with EU legal luminaries had confirmed a member state may withdraw an Article 50 bid within the two-year negotiation period or longer if there had been an extension. He predicted there was "well over" a 30 per cent chance of negotiations breaking down during the two years after Article 50 is triggered. But, he admitted: 'Walking away away would be a disaster for business and citizens alike." Lord Kerr, who claimed the Article 50 white paper was short on facts, said custom controls caused delays which damaged modern global supply chains.
